"}, {'created': '2018-02-20 19:20:45.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Make the git clone and wheel build optional

To cut down on unnecessary build time, the repo build
process can now be set (using the minimal build type)
to only build what is absolutely required in order to
facilitate the execution of the integrated build.

The minimal build only builds the venvs and does not
bother downloading the git repositories or building
the wheels any more. The git repositories are
downloaded by any of the hosts which need them, and
the wheels are downloaded through the reverse proxy
setup to cache pypi on the repo server.

The constraints used are split out into multiple files
to make their purpose and application more obvious, and
also to allow us to get rid of all the jinja required
to process the various sources from upstream into a
single file given that pip is able to resolve them
itself (it uses the first applicable constraint it
finds). Once the integrated build is using these files
we can removed the majority of the complexity from the
repo_build role.

Tasks are heavily commented to specify notes to bear
in mind and where tasks are removable once dependencies
are removed from other repositories.

The test-vars are updated to help with the full build
tests. The variables are updated to match recent changes
in the gnocchi repository.

TODO:
- write up a release note

- define a data structure which can replace the py_pkgs
  lookup

- get rid of the pip links configuration in the integrated
  build as it's no longer necessary - pypiserver serves
  anything it has

- complete make all pip configuration present in pip.conf
  right from the start, rather than using cli options in
  the build or pip install tasks - this makes what's
  happening much more obvious and much simpler to keep
  consistent between humans doing things and ansible doing
  things

Change-Id: I90fd488956f3d5f9e8ad6f189b635e6a083d0a27
Implements: blueprint python-build-install-simplification
Signed-off-by: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>

commit_message:
Make the git clone and wheel build optional

To cut down on unnecessary build time, the repo build
process can now be set (using the minimal build type)
to only build what is absolutely required in order to
facilitate the execution of the integrated build.

The minimal build only builds the venvs and does not
bother downloading the git repositories or building
the wheels any more. The git repositories are
downloaded by any of the hosts which need them, and
the wheels are downloaded through the reverse proxy
setup to cache pypi on the repo server.

The constraints used are split out into multiple files
to make their purpose and application more obvious, and
also to allow us to get rid of all the jinja required
to process the various sources from upstream into a
single file given that pip is able to resolve them
itself (it uses the first applicable constraint it
finds). Once the integrated build is using these files
we can removed the majority of the complexity from the
repo_build role.

Tasks are heavily commented to specify notes to bear
in mind and where tasks are removable once dependencies
are removed from other repositories.

The test-vars are updated to help with the full build
tests. The variables are updated to match recent changes
in the gnocchi repository.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/547762
Change-Id: I90fd488956f3d5f9e8ad6f189b635e6a083d0a27
Implements: blueprint python-build-install-simplification
Signed-off-by: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>

subject: Set the default pip index to use the pypi cache when possible

[{'created': '2017-11-24 12:27:51.000000000', 'message': 'Set the default pip index to use the pypi cache when possible

Once the repo server is up, the pypi cache will be available
to be used. This implements the changes to detect whether it
is available - this is important for the plays doing pip
installs before the repo server is available. Once it is
available the same plays will use it.

All playbooks after the repo-server playbook will then
benefit from using it.

Change-Id: I307da89d44a893c4e0d9cdf17296192c3db36b3f
Depends-On: I56f22f46ff849a7049ac7ae873af7a4bc526fa63

is available - this is important for the plays doing pip
installs before the repo server is available. Once it is
available the same plays will use it.

All playbooks after the repo-server playbook will then
benefit from using it.

We also remove the use of the pip_lock_to_internal_repo
variable as we want to change the pip.conf to set the
index, instead of setting no-index and only relying on
links.

commit_message:
Set the default pip index to use the pypi cache when possible

Once the repo server is up, the pypi cache will be available
to be used. This implements the changes to detect whether it
is available - this is important for the plays doing pip
installs before the repo server is available. Once it is
available the same plays will use it.

All playbooks after the repo-server playbook will then
benefit from using it.

We also remove the use of the pip_lock_to_internal_repo
variable as we want to change the pip.conf to set the
index, instead of setting no-index and only relying on
links.

Finally, we set the AIO in OpenStack-Infra to make use of
the appropriate infra mirror for the nginx reverse proxy.

Change-Id: I307da89d44a893c4e0d9cdf17296192c3db36b3f
Depends-On: I56f22f46ff849a7049ac7ae873af7a4bc526fa63
Depends-On: Ic4fd64f4dc82121a65088f3d7f4ae53f373df608
Depends-On: I7bd31f2d89d3fe9d48e32c79ddef7a8ef1392eb7
Depends-On: Icd93c0c801bfee1b4fdc8154d078067722c0640a
Depends-On: I1e9782eb0fd72690a9644c7a01e8c83a4486872b
Implements: blueprint python-build-install-simplification
Signed-off-by: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>

subject: Add support for Dell PowerConnect switches
messages:
[{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-06-07 17:36:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-06-08 09:16:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11933, 'date': '2018-06-13 21:41:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-06-19 18:32:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-06-20 08:33:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Updated to fix an issue with trunk port configuration found during further testing. Should be good to go now.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-06-20 10:02:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-06-20 11:23:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

More testing, more issues...

Seeing the following message from the switch, which prevents switch configuration when multiple configuration sessions are active:

Configuration Database locked by another application - try later

Due to the lack of error checking in NGS, this failure is silently ignored.

We could use the support in NGS for limiting concurrent sessions via etcd, but we still run the risk that an operator is manually configuring the switch.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-06-22 14:10:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-06-25 10:11:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-06-25 13:06:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-06-27 09:27:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-06-27 09:29:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-06-28 09:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-07-03 07:15:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-07 17:36:57.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for Dell PowerConnect switches

Dell PowerConnect switches have a different user interface from the
newer Force10 switches, and therefore require a different NGS driver.

This change adds a netmiko_dell_powerconnect device driver.

Change-Id: Ie0cba55cfdf28cf0854a689414f2773ca55372d9
Story: 2002179

commit_message:
Add support for Dell PowerConnect switches

Dell PowerConnect switches have a different user interface from the
newer Force10 switches, and therefore require a different NGS driver.

This change adds a netmiko_dell_powerconnect device driver.

Change-Id: Ie0cba55cfdf28cf0854a689414f2773ca55372d9
Story: 2002179

commit_message:
Merge server create schema for keypair extension

As nova extensions has been deprecated already and goal is to
merge all scattered code into main controller side.
Currently schema and request/response extended code are there
among all extensions.

This commit merge the schema part of create server for keypair extensions.

Partially implements: blueprint api-extensions-merge-rocky

Change-Id: I56b044863a2454601d3f4534bace229a94c4f0e3

[{'created': '2018-05-17 17:03:29.000000000', 'message': "Fix invalid escape sequence warnings

Starting with Python 3.6, invalid escape sequences in string literals
are now deprecated[1]. This influence also automatic style checkers like
pycodestyle which starting with 2.4.0 complains about invalid escape
sequences (W605)[2].

Let's fix all those warnings at once by using raw strings where possible
and adding additional \ where not.

Footnotes:

Signed-off-by: Krzysztof Opasiak <k.opasiak@samsung.com>

commit_message:
Fix invalid escape sequence warnings

Starting with Python 3.6, invalid escape sequences in string literals
are now deprecated[1]. This influence also automatic style checkers like
pycodestyle which starting with 2.4.0 complains about invalid escape
sequences (W605)[2].

Let's fix all those warnings at once by using raw strings where possible
and adding additional \ where not.

Footnotes:
1 - https://docs.python.org/3/whatsnew/3.6.html#deprecated-python-behavior
2 - https://github.com/PyCQA/pycodestyle/pull/676

Change-Id: I009a366fd8342edfd30890df6fe8e1fca88bf3cc
Signed-off-by: Krzysztof Opasiak <k.opasiak@samsung.com>

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-03 07:29:57.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I540a504b42f43eac3c25424fd947e04f880071e9
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I540a504b42f43eac3c25424fd947e04f880071e9

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I7b65a9dbb394224550008f0feeb5a47bb743c208

, and then add a Depends-On to this patch in your patch.'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-04-02 11:27:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-04-02 13:38:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10608, 'date': '2018-04-02 15:10:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-10 19:43:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I'm having some trouble understanding what this fixes. Are the tests doing something with class names directly? Or is something else doing something with them?"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-04-10 19:51:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> I'm having some trouble understanding what this fixes. Are the tests doing something with class names directly? Or is something else doing something with them?

It was a weird break.  We had code buried waaay down in a library that does a split('_').  There were a few test paths which resulted in the thing being split actually being a mock.  Before these underscore-havin classes existed in the hierarchy, the str()ification of those mocks didn't have underscores, and the tests worked.  After, with the underscore-havin class names, the split was happening in the wrong spot (or too many times, or something), so suddenly the result of the split wasn't comparing right to the thing we were expecting.

We've fixed the problem on our end by making sure those values wound up being actual strings instead of auto mocks.  So this patch is optional from that perspective.  There could be others affected similarly; but then again, they could be affected for other reasons than underscores too."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-10 20:23:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

> > I'm having some trouble understanding what this fixes. Are the
 > tests doing something with class names directly? Or is something
 > else doing something with them?
 > 
 > It was a weird break.  We had code buried waaay down in a library
 > that does a split('_').  There were a few test paths which resulted

What was it splitting?

 > in the thing being split actually being a mock.  Before these
 > underscore-havin classes existed in the hierarchy, the
 > str()ification of those mocks didn't have underscores, and the
 > tests worked.  After, with the underscore-havin class names, the
 > split was happening in the wrong spot (or too many times, or
 > something), so suddenly the result of the split wasn't comparing
 > right to the thing we were expecting.

OK. It sounds like those tests are poorly constructed if they are relying on class names following specific patterns.

 > We've fixed the problem on our end by making sure those values
 > wound up being actual strings instead of auto mocks.  So this patch
 > is optional from that perspective.  There could be others affected
 > similarly; but then again, they could be affected for other reasons
 > than underscores too.

If this is option, I would prefer we not make the change. We do not want these classes used directly."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-04-10 20:59:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> What was it splitting?

It's... complicated.

We have a TaskFlow Task derivative called FeedTask [1] that (internally) accumulates return values from subtasks in a dictionary whose keys are based on a UUID [2], where the UUID is a @property of the object which is the basis for the FeedTask's operations.  So we end up with keys like 'wrapper_%s' % uuid.  We later go to split that [3] so we can process those results.  When we're testing FeedTask flows in our driver, we're using a fixture [4] into which is fed (e.g. [5]) these objects from which the UUID is pulled (e.g. [6]).  A "VIOS" is a very complicated thing, which is why we mock it.  Previously, there was no reason for [6] to include a "real" value for `uuid`, because all the underscore splitting and joining happened to work fine (because no underscores in the str()ified automock coming out of .uuid).

> OK. It sounds like those tests are poorly constructed if they are relying on class names following specific patterns.

I hope the above has convinced you that this was not the result of poor test design.  We were not (deliberately) relying on class names in the test libraries following specific patterns, any more than Nova was deliberately relying on self.flags not doing file system operations [7].

> If this is option, I would prefer we not make the change. We do not want these classes used directly.

Sure, that's fine as far as nova-powervm is concerned at this point, because we fixed it there [8] by finding the offending mocks and giving those UUIDs explicit values rather than letting them auto-mock.

[1] https://github.com/powervm/pypowervm/blob/release/1.1.13/pypowervm/utils/transaction.py#L498
[2] https://github.com/powervm/pypowervm/blob/release/1.1.13/pypowervm/utils/transaction.py#L619
[3] https://github.com/powervm/pypowervm/blob/release/1.1.13/pypowervm/utils/transaction.py#L742
[4] https://github.com/powervm/pypowervm/blob/release/1.1.13/pypowervm/tests/test_fixtures.py#L370
[5] https://github.com/openstack/nova-powervm/blob/master/nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/disk/test_ssp.py#L373
[6] https://github.com/openstack/nova-powervm/blob/master/nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/disk/test_ssp.py#L83
[7] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558084/
[8] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/557975/'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-04-10 21:19:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hm, to give a simpler explanation on what broke in the nova_powervm unit tests:

Basically, how mock works: you create a new mock:

    >>> import mock
    >>> m = mock.MagicMock()

Then, you access / print one of its attribute which was not specifically set:

    >>> print(m.foo)
    <MagicMock name='mock.foo' id='53708560'>

This is simply how it works.

Now, they are using nova.test as a base in their unit tests, which currently uses the oslotest mock fixture we're added. Which means, that the above print would actually look something like this:

    >>> print(m.foo)
    >>> <_AutospecMagicMock name='mock.foo' id='53708560'>

Then, at one point, they str()igified m.uuid, and then had to do a .rsplit('_')[1] (basically, stripping the string of any prefix like "this_"). Well, as you can see, that split would have given them "AutospecMagicMock name='mock.foo' id='53708560'>", which was unexpected for them, the expected string was all of it.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-11 13:21:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Hm, to give a simpler explanation on what broke in the nova_powervm
 > unit tests:
 > 
 > Basically, how mock works: you create a new mock:
 > 
 > >>> import mock
 > >>> m = mock.MagicMock()
 > 
 > Then, you access / print one of its attribute which was not
 > specifically set:
 > 
 > >>> print(m.foo)
 > <MagicMock name='mock.foo' id='53708560'>
 > 
 > This is simply how it works.
 > 
 > Now, they are using nova.test as a base in their unit tests, which
 > currently uses the oslotest mock fixture we're added. Which means,
 > that the above print would actually look something like this:
 > 
 > >>> print(m.foo)
 > >>> <_AutospecMagicMock name='mock.foo' id='53708560'>
 > 
 > Then, at one point, they str()igified m.uuid, and then had to do a
 > .rsplit('_')[1] (basically, stripping the string of any prefix like
 > "this_"). Well, as you can see, that split would have given them
 > "AutospecMagicMock name='mock.foo' id='53708560'>", which was
 > unexpected for them, the expected string was all of it.

Right, so the mock was created without a valid uuid value, which would have allowed str(m.uuid) to produce just the UUID which would have complied with the expected value.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-04-11 20:39:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Right, so the mock was created without a valid uuid value

That's correct.  And without a valid value for the dozens of other fields in a VIOS wrapper, some of which also get used incidentally in the course of running a test that's not specifically testing the functionality of a VIOS wrapper.  This is what automatic mocks are good for - their very raison d'être.

Still fine with merging or abandoning this."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-11 21:36:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> > Right, so the mock was created without a valid uuid value
 > 
 > That's correct.  And without a valid value for the dozens of other
 > fields in a VIOS wrapper, some of which also get used incidentally
 > in the course of running a test that's not specifically testing the
 > functionality of a VIOS wrapper.  This is what automatic mocks are
 > good for - their very raison d'être.

It sounds like what is needed is a factory for creating *valid* mocks that have those values. The automatic mocks aren't fulfilling enough of the API of the object being mocked out."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-04-11 22:13:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> It sounds like what is needed is a factory for creating *valid* mocks that have those values. The automatic mocks aren't fulfilling enough of the API of the object being mocked out.

Well, that's sort of what autospec is for.  But autospec doesn't go far enough to have covered something like this.  Nor should it.  The performance would be abysmal, and trying to come up with a specification meta-syntax would be the project of a lifetime.

I think what we have for automocking is fine.  When we find we need some internal piece to be something other than an automock, we define it, and that works.  We didn't need it in this case; and then a change to the lib prompted us to need it.  So we fixed it.  It was a weird one, but not a big deal."}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-04-16 07:36:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I think we can go ahead and abandon this then. If there aren't any objections, I'll abandon this tomorrow."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-04-16 14:38:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Fine by me.  Thanks for the help, Claudiu.'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-07-03 08:09:14.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
mock: Removes underscore from autospec mock classes

Originally, the underscore in _AutospecMock and _AutospecMagicMock
has been added in order to discourage their direct usage outside of
oslotest, MockAutospecFixture should be used to replace mock.Mock
and mock.MagicMock with their autospec versions.

But the underscore can break some unit tests [1], especially those that
split the stringified mock by undercore.

Related-Bug: #1735588

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/557956/

Change-Id: I0e0bb5629f63ec18af27b26cb5675ff88f041c00

[{'created': '2018-07-02 12:42:23.000000000', 'message': 'useful-image-properties.rst: Update default RNG source

Nova's libvirt driver has changed[*] the default source from /dev/random
to /dev/urandom:

    "Since libvirt 1.3.4, any RNG (Random Number Generator) device path
    (that returns random numbers when read!) is accepted. However, the
    recommended source of entropy is `/dev/urandom` (it is non-blocking;
    and doesn't have the same limitations of `dev/random`, which is a
    legacy interface)."

Update the relevant Glance documentation to reflect that.

[*] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/commit/?id=814bfd93

Change-Id: I656b5c244b98202f3c8d019d0bbeddc4e7c0314a
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
useful-image-properties.rst: Update default RNG source

Nova's libvirt driver has changed[*] the default source from /dev/random
to /dev/urandom:

    "Since libvirt 1.3.4, any RNG (Random Number Generator) device path
    (that returns random numbers when read!) is accepted. However, the
    recommended source of entropy is `/dev/urandom` (it is non-blocking;
    and doesn't have the same limitations of `dev/random`, which is a
    legacy interface)."

Update the relevant Glance documentation to reflect that.

[*] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/commit/?id=814bfd93

Change-Id: I656b5c244b98202f3c8d019d0bbeddc4e7c0314a
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-27 02:42:47.000000000', 'message': "Don't re-use resource-properties-data in backup stacks

When purging events we are only able to (efficiently) search for
references to resource properties data from events and resources in the
same stack. This results in foreign key constraint errors if the
resource properties data is referenced from a backup stack. To avoid
this, don't reuse resource properties data IDs after moving a resource
between the backup and main stacks, but duplicate the data instead.

Change-Id: I93329197c99a2dba37b0e1dbd7efe7b2b17bc036
Story: #2002643
Task: 22510
"}]
commit_message:
Don't re-use resource-properties-data in backup stacks

When purging events we are only able to (efficiently) search for
references to resource properties data from events and resources in the
same stack. This results in foreign key constraint errors if the
resource properties data is referenced from a backup stack. To avoid
this, don't reuse resource properties data IDs after moving a resource
between the backup and main stacks, but duplicate the data instead.

Change-Id: I93329197c99a2dba37b0e1dbd7efe7b2b17bc036
Story: #2002643
Task: 22510

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-21 05:01:18.000000000', 'message': 'Make Swift log_level changeable

The log_level in Swift is fixed to INFO. The patch make it changeable
according to the value of "openstack_logging_debug".

When "openstack_logging_debug" is "False", the log_level is set to
"INFO". It is default value. Otherwise, the log_level is set to
"DEBUG".

Closes-Bug: #1777982

Change-Id: I62f430abd8f332cc2ece56a6733776fa03b10f77
Signed-off-by: tone.zhang <tone.zhang@arm.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-06-21 06:02:22.000000000', 'message': 'Make Swift log_level changeable

The log_level in Swift is fixed to INFO. The patch make it changeable
according to the value of "openstack_logging_debug".

When "openstack_logging_debug" is "False", the log_level is set to
"INFO". It is default value. Otherwise, the log_level is set to
"DEBUG".

Closes-Bug: #1777982

commit_message:
Make Swift log_level changeable

The log_level in Swift is fixed to INFO. The patch make it changeable
according to the value of "openstack_logging_debug".

When "openstack_logging_debug" is "False", the log_level is set to
"INFO". It is default value. Otherwise, the log_level is set to
"DEBUG".

Closes-Bug: #1777982

Change-Id: I62f430abd8f332cc2ece56a6733776fa03b10f77
Signed-off-by: tone.zhang <tone.zhang@arm.com>

commit_message:
Optimise the destroy role by script module

Ansible provide script module to run shell script, The local script at
path will be transferred to the remote node and then executed, so no
need to copy script to remote node and use shell moulde to run it.
this patch optimise it.

Change-Id: If774502b66652f25593cda137cc8a5baefbd9695
(cherry picked from commit 8f2256d2990d62bedba885cb3609b242559bc38d)

commit_message:
Enable yamllint strict mode

To make sure we can find the yaml warning before code merge[1].
We can enable strict mode to treat warning as error[2].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573482/1
[2] http://yamllint.readthedocs.io/en/stable/configuration.html#errors-and-warnings

Change-Id: I0b54bc2bd384f092f2fcd1b0396e133a0d95befe

2 backends must exist (not required for this case)

2) Sure, will do

3) It's not in the documentation but jungleboyj confirmed that he will add the same 
whoami-rajat: You have a good point on the documentation.  A number of people have been confused by this in the past and we don't have it well documented.  I will add documentation for this.	12:28
jungleboyj	whoami-rajat:  So there are two ways you can do retype.  You can retype and have Cinder do whatever it has to to make the the volume fit the new type.  I.E. I want to make an LVM backed volume and NFS based volume.  That is when you need to use 'on-demand' migration saying it is ok to move the volume from one storage backend to another.	12:29
jungleboyj	whoami-rajat:  The other option is you just want to retype the storage to change other extra specs or something like that on the volume but you don't actually want to allow the storage to move to a different storage backend.  That is when the 'never' policy is used.  It is used by default to ensure that users don't accidentally move their storage to another storage backend when that is not their intention."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-06-12 10:30:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

 > policy is used.  It is used by default to ensure that users don't
 > accidentally move their storage to another storage backend when
 > that is not their intention.

So we can do that by inheritance. make a base class there with all common code and make 2 test class one testing the policy 'in-demand' and other 'never'. 

test with 'never' policy should verify that backend is same after migration and there should be some other extra specs changed."}, {'account_id': 27078, 'date': '2018-06-12 10:42:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

volume without migration, so adding new test for it.

commit_message:
Fix parameter description in volume and snapshot manage extension

The parameters 'cinder_id', 'reason_not_safe', 'extra_info' can be None,
but are required in the response body of listing detail of managable
volumes or snapshots.

Change-Id: Iade148d2afeaae486aab4dc789d52e9522f206ee

[{'created': '2018-06-20 05:39:44.000000000', 'message': 'Enable systemd service helm-serve

When the system is restarted, the helm service is not running,
which results in the failure of the helm command.

Change-Id: I476b7f2e8fc0948d0fb04f51d852080281c265bf
'}]
commit_message:
Enable systemd service helm-serve

When the system is restarted, the helm service is not running,
which results in the failure of the helm command.

Change-Id: I476b7f2e8fc0948d0fb04f51d852080281c265bf

commit_message:
Convert Nova APIs to WSGI services

To be consistent with the install guide[1], the Nova services should be
deployed as WSGI services.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/queens/install/controller-install-ubuntu.html

Change-Id: I49a767724e744f98d7f008411755c063f96a4c9d

Add os-acc to openstack repo

OS-ACC is a lib implements the nova/cyborg interaction.

Change-Id: If2d59686c62fdbe2fac44519f8e013d26f78892f

commit_message:
Simplify identity endpoint

Per the Keystone Install Guide[1] the admin endpoint is superseded in
favor of a single public endpoint. As a result, the admin endpoint is no
longer deployed by default.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/queens/install/keystone-install-ubuntu.html#install-and-configure-components

- gate-kolla-ansible-dsvm-deploy-oraclelinux-binary-centos-7-nv http://logs.openstack.org/15/466615/2/check/gate-kolla-ansible-dsvm-deploy-oraclelinux-binary-centos-7-nv/c9bb3f9/ : FAILURE in 17m 14s (non-voting)
- gate-kolla-ansible-dsvm-deploy-oraclelinux-source-centos-7-nv http://logs.openstack.org/15/466615/2/check/gate-kolla-ansible-dsvm-deploy-oraclelinux-source-centos-7-nv/e0b75ec/ : FAILURE in 16m 42s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2017-05-22 08:03:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

More changes are needed, although this change won't work in current deployment model.
Creation of cell0 cell is made here [1] this cell creation takes the db value from [database]/connection value from your config file unless --database_connection is added into the command. This value is stored in nova_api db.

Excerpt from [2] :
If you are not going to pass the database url on the command line in step 3, you need to name the cell0 database based on the name of your existing Nova database: <Nova database name>_cell0.
Based of above, current {{ nova_database_name }}_cell0 is correct.

What i'm not sure is, how db sync for cell is handled, takes value from database=connection option or use the value stored in the nova_api db to sync the data, and how cell0 knows what db to use once set up. I think database=connection value is the correct way to handle this, and each cell points to it's connection name.

BTW, cell0 is an especial cell, is only used to store unscheduled or failed to schedule instances, is not a "real" functional cell.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/roles/nova/tasks/simple_cell_setup.yml#L4
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/cells.html#cells-v2'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2017-05-22 08:13:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I(n fact i believe current imprementation is OK, since nova_cell0 depends on nova DB. For other cells correct way is having its whatever_database_name value who no inherits from nova (legacy) database'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-07-01 00:42:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

commit_message:
Publish Devstack docs for stable branch too

Currently Devstack docs are built for master only but
we should have those published for stable branch also as
Devstack is branched.

This commit allows Devstack docs to be published by template
'publish-openstack-sphinx-docs'

Change-Id: I854e810d2f328387a6e6c6b1af4ceda54c4f5cb7

messages:
[{'account_id': 24574, 'date': '2018-07-03 01:23:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2018-07-03 03:13:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

when puting large object, better to use --striper paramater

http://docs.ceph.com/docs/kraken/man/8/rados/#cmdoption-rados--striper

https://ceph.com/planet/rados-put-striper%E5%8A%9F%E8%83%BD%E7%9A%84%E8%B0%83%E8%AF%95/'}, {'account_id': 24574, 'date': '2018-07-03 05:05:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> when puting large object, better to use --striper paramater
 > 
 > http://docs.ceph.com/docs/kraken/man/8/rados/#cmdoption-rados--striper
 > 
 > https://ceph.com/planet/rados-put-striper%E5%8A%9F%E8%83%BD%E7%9A%84%E8%B0%83%E8%AF%95/

Hi Jeffrey,

Thanks a lot for the comments. After check further, the default osd_max_object_size in bluestore and filestore are both 128MB. It seems no negative impact when migrate data from filestore to bluestore OSD.

I will abandon the change. Thanks a lot! :)'}, {'account_id': 24574, 'date': '2018-07-03 05:19:00.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-03 01:23:48.000000000', 'message': 'Extend the value of "osd max object size" in Ceph bluestore OSD

In Ceph bluestore OSD, the default value of "osd max object size"
is 100MB.

In Ceph filestore OSD, the default value is 1GB.

The patch extends the value of bluestore OSD to be the same as
filestore OSD.

Closes-Bug: #1779792

Change-Id: I6ffa18b58824238a375114fb1312ac6e6d5a02fd
Signed-off-by: tone.zhang <tone.zhang@arm.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Extend the value of "osd max object size" in Ceph bluestore OSD

In Ceph bluestore OSD, the default value of "osd max object size"
is 100MB.

In Ceph filestore OSD, the default value is 1GB.

The patch extends the value of bluestore OSD to be the same as
filestore OSD.

Closes-Bug: #1779792

Change-Id: I6ffa18b58824238a375114fb1312ac6e6d5a02fd
Signed-off-by: tone.zhang <tone.zhang@arm.com>

commit_message:
Modify show aggregate to display 'updated_at' value

In 'openstack show aggregate ' command 'updated_at' field is
always None. This commit fixes the same to retrieve the correct value.

Change-Id: I728f30999bcfb806c07a8c2fd3fad0f72391b97d
Closes-Bug: #1663456

commit_message:
Routed Networks - peer-subnet/segment host-routes (2/2)

Ensure that host routes are maintained for each subnet within
a network. Subnets associated with different segments on the
same network get host_routes entries added/removed as subnets
are created, deleted or updated.

This change handle the host_routes for the peer subnets on the
same network when a subnet is created or deleted.

Also adds a shim api extension.

APIImpact: Host routes are now calculated for routed networks.
Closes-Bug: #1766380
Change-Id: Iafbabe6352283e7f1a535a7b147bd81fb32f0ed1

commit_message:

This patch removes duplicate registration of session of
option 'timeout' under [keystone_authtoken] as it is
registered in keystonemiddleware in patch[1].

commit_message:
Modifying 'whole_disk_image_url' and 'whole_disk_image_checksum' variable

Need to set variable whole_disk_image_url and
whole_disk_image_checksum in tempest.conf
irrespective of IPXE is enabled or disabled.

Also setting the ping_timeout for standalone ironic
like we are setting ssh_timeout in case node is
taking more time for becoming active.

This change is required for iLO-CI as iLO-CI is
running tests as standalone ironic.

Change-Id: Idef1bc876fe440824894332a211af9a10401e49c
Closes-Bug: #1748849

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-06 19:28:02.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I01e8cf1b70d7a1501dccd26bf30db52e36dedb38
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I01e8cf1b70d7a1501dccd26bf30db52e36dedb38
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-27 04:15:03.000000000', 'message': 'NEC driver: Reuse iSCSI LUNs of detached volumes.

Currently, NEC driver does not reuse iSCSI LUNs of detached volumes.
The driver always use the LUN of (max(LUNs used) + 1) to attach
a volume.

If multi-target mode of NEC Storage is enabled, the driver works
without the problem because only LUN0s are used in the multi-target
mode.

This patch changes the using LUN to min(LUNs not used) for reusing
a LUN of detached volume with multi-target mode disabled.

Change-Id: I067cb09928c4c9d4ebb7159950fff526ee70f1bb
Closes-Bug: #1778669
'}]
commit_message:
NEC driver: Reuse iSCSI LUNs of detached volumes.

Currently, NEC driver does not reuse iSCSI LUNs of detached volumes.
The driver always use the LUN of (max(LUNs used) + 1) to attach
a volume.

If multi-target mode of NEC Storage is enabled, the driver works
without the problem because only LUN0s are used in the multi-target
mode.

This patch changes the using LUN to min(LUNs not used) for reusing
a LUN of detached volume with multi-target mode disabled.

Change-Id: I067cb09928c4c9d4ebb7159950fff526ee70f1bb
Closes-Bug: #1778669

commit_message:
Allocation candidates parameter: required (v1.17)

New parameter to 'allocation candidate list':
    --required TRAIT [--required ...]

New output field of 'allocation candidate list':
    traits

Change-Id: Ie70497981ff4295b3ccd6b495b21bbb919d92c47
Partially-Implements: blueprint placement-osc-plugin-rocky

commit_message:
Limit allocation candidates (v1.15, v1.16)

v1.15:
Microversion 1.15 does not need any support in osc
so we just skip over that in this patch.

v1.16:
New optional parameter to allocation candidate list:
    --limit N

Change-Id: Ic23dc4274c6fe42bfdf97fec55ddf0c36462501c
Partially-Implements: blueprint placement-osc-plugin-rocky

commit_message:
Add nested resource providers (v1.14)

New fields to the output of resource provider list/show/create/set:
  root_provider_uuid
  parent_provider_uuid

New optional parameter to resource provider create:
  --parent-provider UUID

New optional parameter to resource provider set:
  --parent-provider UUID

New optional parameter to resource provider list:
  --in-tree UUID

Change-Id: Iafefbfce6b439190909476fd40ccb74ffb511b5d
Partially-Implements: blueprint placement-osc-plugin-rocky
Related-Bug: #1770636

commit_message:
Specifically enable plugins for uwsgi

When using distribution based uwsgi, we may have to explicitly specify
more plugins in the configuration file as they are not built in by
default.  Add http, http-socket (maybe only needed for glance?),
python, python3.

Change-Id: I111f2b1311b67836757496a0eac19f79a1b64073

commit_message:
Add note about standalone being only in master

It only works in master but our repository list has all the stable
versions. Need to address that seperately but for now, let's at least
warn people ahead of time.

Change-Id: I3f37d5b83625d653f96ebcd4c4744e7fd46c72e7

subject: OVN: Remove environment files which deploy OVN dbs in non HA
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'shardy@redhat.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 10237, 'name': 'Numan Siddique', 'email': 'nusiddiq@redhat.com', 'username': 'numansiddique'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 18575, 'name': 'Saravanan KR', 'email': 'krsacme@gmail.com', 'username': 'saravanankr'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]

Looks OK but please can you add a release note listing the removed environments, and which one should be used instead now they're gone?"}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-06-29 10:12:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Also what is the upgrade impact of this?  E.g are we confident nobody has deployed in this configuration, and/or if they have what steps do they need to take on upgrade to migrate to the supported configuration?'}, {'account_id': 10237, 'date': '2018-06-29 11:18:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Looks OK but please can you add a release note listing the removed
 > environments, and which one should be used instead now they're
 > gone?

Ack. Will do"}, {'account_id': 10237, 'date': '2018-06-29 11:20:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Also what is the upgrade impact of this?  E.g are we confident
 > nobody has deployed in this configuration, and/or if they have what
 > steps do they need to take on upgrade to migrate to the supported
 > configuration?

In Pike, ovn services were not containerized fully. And I don't think we can provide a way to upgrade. I think I am pretty confident of not much users with non HA deployments."}, {'account_id': 10237, 'date': '2018-06-29 11:34:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2018-06-29 11:44:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-06-29 12:20:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-28 12:48:27.000000000', 'message': 'OVN: Remove environment files which deploy OVN dbs in non HA

In a 3 node controller deployment OVN db servers are started only on one node
and if that node goes down, we hit the down time for ovsdb-servers and neutron-server.

So it is highly recommended to deploy OVN db servers as a pacemaker HA resource.

Change-Id: Ia2f50d539bf6afbeb67610a925f9f4ea0849d735
Closes-bug: #1779123

commit_message:
OVN: Remove environment files which deploy OVN dbs in non HA

In a 3 node controller deployment OVN db servers are started only on one node
and if that node goes down, we hit the down time for ovsdb-servers and neutron-server.

So it is highly recommended to deploy OVN db servers as a pacemaker HA resource.

Change-Id: Ia2f50d539bf6afbeb67610a925f9f4ea0849d735
Closes-bug: #1779123

This patch will bring newest neutron code from master and
avoid to some issues when neutron is updating.

Change-Id: Id5848e119a7927fe1e4a00aa2a810b2e6265dca3
'}]
commit_message:
Update neutron code master for project

This patch will bring newest neutron code from master and
avoid to some issues when neutron is updating.

Change-Id: Id5848e119a7927fe1e4a00aa2a810b2e6265dca3

[{'created': '2018-06-29 08:30:03.000000000', 'message': '       Fix the unit test error

        1. What is the problem?

           the unit test can not pass, because the devstack

           local.conf set the OS_PASSWORD but it is not take

           effect in really machine.

        2. What is the solution to the problem?

           after the devstac run export the OS_PASSWORD as

           define in the devstack.

        3. What the features to be implemented in the Tricircle to realize the solution?

           it is look like a bug of devstack. it is not look good the just export the

           OS_PASSWORD, later on I will pull a bug for this in devstack bug list.wait on

           devstack to fix this bug. otherwise we can get the OS_PASSWORD from devstack

           local file and export it.

        Signed-off-by: song baisen <songbaisen@szzt.com.cn>

commit_message:
Fix the unit test error

        1. What is the problem?

           the unit test can not pass.

        2. What is the solution to the problem?

           after the devstac run export the OS_PASSWORD as

           define in the devstack.

        3. What the features to be implemented in the Tricircle to realize the solution?

           I compare the faild and before passed local.conf they are all the same. so

           it is look like a bug of devstack. later on I will pull a bug for this in

           devstack bug list.wait on devstack to fix this bug.

        Signed-off-by: song baisen <songbaisen@szzt.com.cn>

        Co-Authored-By: tangzhuo <ztang@hnu.edu.cn>, zhiyuan_cai <luckyvega.g@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I0c004ca3a7f31159372ff69d6e7ea0dcede0e66a

commit_message:
Register and document policy in code

This patch moves default policy definitions from file-based maintenance
to registering them in code following OpenStack standard[1].

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/policy-in-code.html

Change-Id: I47afa929ebfa30e17c2dbeac31108ecbab67f067
Implements: blueprint policy-in-code

commit_message:
Mark unit test test_get_objects_queries_constant as unstable

This test is failing a lot in our check and gate queues.
It's reported in [1].
To make life easier, this test will be marked as unstable
until [1] will be fixed.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1775220

Change-Id: Ie37e72b98f0d8e6e3ccafb1fe38a57bd50777331
Related-Bug: #1775220
(cherry picked from commit c4ea8ba82bb0e5c3026330333c9a88c88ab930ee)

commit_message:
ovs: removed sinkhole RPC target for old topics

The oslo.messaging bug that triggered adding the hack is fixed in
Queens, so we don't need it anymore.

Change-Id: I775b466dce19c4168985b19e1ddb938118f48dcb
Related-Bug: #1705351
(cherry picked from commit 46cbe459ea812ec6ca18b2f597f295e0755927ae)

commit_message:
Convert type of 'command' from string to list

Zun is currently using a string representation of 'command',
but Docker is returning 'Cmd' in string representation. This
requires a conversion of commands between list and string,
which is complicated and error-prone (it might causes bugs like
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/551795/).
It is better to switch from string to list

Co-Authored-By: Hongbin Lu <hongbin034@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ie0df504a67cc20907d35e3513fd80d3f6be687fd
Closes-Bug: #1755019

commit_message:
Revert "add neutron/networking projects to blacklist for queens"

This breaks the stable branches. We don't constrain any of the
neutron plugins on the stable branches. We are reverting the addition of neutron-lbaas to g-r, blacklist, and the upper-constraints.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/579725/
This reverts commit 0afc5ccf774e2d0f5aa6a8f1988bc3c11c859a80.

Change-Id: I93f1fa8ac2086427e5255b555aa99c7a19e609e7

[{'created': '2018-06-28 15:30:04.000000000', 'message': 'Move database creation into role (octavia)

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we remove the group_vars which were duplicated from the
role, and remove the DB setup tasks as they are no longer required.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/578849
Change-Id: If1aae993adae0417841dd91f914c58f101d191b2
'}]
commit_message:
Move database creation into role (octavia)

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we remove the group_vars which were duplicated from the
role, and remove the DB setup tasks as they are no longer required.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/578849
Change-Id: If1aae993adae0417841dd91f914c58f101d191b2

commit_message:
Run cinder's db sync only on bootstrap node

The sync_db variable (which is True only on bootstrap node) needs to be
passed to the ::cinder::api resource to ensure the db sync only happens
on the bootstrap node.

Closes-Bug: #1779112
Change-Id: Ib7fcafbe769aadfcc58323ba3a06fa28a80a488a

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-15 08:09:26.000000000', 'message': "Don't set administratively disabled ports as ACTIVE

There was a race condition during port update to disable it.
In case when neutron-server receives port update call to set
admin_state_down on port, it sends PORT_UPDATE notification
to agents.

Then both L2 and DHCP agents start doing their job with port.
L2 agent asks neutron-server about device details and during
processing this call server sets port's status to DOWN if
its admin_state_up = False.
Problem is that sometimes just after that, DHCP agent will send
to neutron server notification that provisioning for this port
is finished.
As there is no any other provisioning block in db (because it
is just port update) neutron-server is setting port's status
to ACTIVE.

This patch fixes this issue by allowing to transition to
ACTIVE only ports which are administratively enabled.

Change-Id: If506e0ff68fc49748f19618470c85901339a419b
Closes-Bug: #1757089
(cherry picked from commit 2a1319ab7a21c2492627c38c5549d20eada899ff)
"}, {'created': '2018-06-19 07:12:15.000000000', 'message': "Don't set administratively disabled ports as ACTIVE

There was a race condition during port update to disable it.
In case when neutron-server receives port update call to set
admin_state_down on port, it sends PORT_UPDATE notification
to agents.

Then both L2 and DHCP agents start doing their job with port.
L2 agent asks neutron-server about device details and during
processing this call server sets port's status to DOWN if
its admin_state_up = False.
Problem is that sometimes just after that, DHCP agent will send
to neutron server notification that provisioning for this port
is finished.
As there is no any other provisioning block in db (because it
is just port update) neutron-server is setting port's status
to ACTIVE.

This patch fixes this issue by allowing to transition to
ACTIVE only ports which are administratively enabled.

Change-Id: If506e0ff68fc49748f19618470c85901339a419b
Closes-Bug: #1757089
(cherry picked from commit 2a1319ab7a21c2492627c38c5549d20eada899ff)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't set administratively disabled ports as ACTIVE

There was a race condition during port update to disable it.
In case when neutron-server receives port update call to set
admin_state_down on port, it sends PORT_UPDATE notification
to agents.

Then both L2 and DHCP agents start doing their job with port.
L2 agent asks neutron-server about device details and during
processing this call server sets port's status to DOWN if
its admin_state_up = False.
Problem is that sometimes just after that, DHCP agent will send
to neutron server notification that provisioning for this port
is finished.
As there is no any other provisioning block in db (because it
is just port update) neutron-server is setting port's status
to ACTIVE.

This patch fixes this issue by allowing to transition to
ACTIVE only ports which are administratively enabled.

Change-Id: If506e0ff68fc49748f19618470c85901339a419b
Closes-Bug: #1757089
(cherry picked from commit 2a1319ab7a21c2492627c38c5549d20eada899ff)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-15 08:23:15.000000000', 'message': "Don't set administratively disabled ports as ACTIVE

There was a race condition during port update to disable it.
In case when neutron-server receives port update call to set
admin_state_down on port, it sends PORT_UPDATE notification
to agents.

Then both L2 and DHCP agents start doing their job with port.
L2 agent asks neutron-server about device details and during
processing this call server sets port's status to DOWN if
its admin_state_up = False.
Problem is that sometimes just after that, DHCP agent will send
to neutron server notification that provisioning for this port
is finished.
As there is no any other provisioning block in db (because it
is just port update) neutron-server is setting port's status
to ACTIVE.

This patch fixes this issue by allowing to transition to
ACTIVE only ports which are administratively enabled.

Change-Id: If506e0ff68fc49748f19618470c85901339a419b
Closes-Bug: #1757089
(cherry picked from commit 2a1319ab7a21c2492627c38c5549d20eada899ff)

As there is no any other provisioning block in db (because it

to ACTIVE.

This patch fixes this issue by allowing to transition to
ACTIVE only ports which are administratively enabled.

Change-Id: If506e0ff68fc49748f19618470c85901339a419b
Closes-Bug: #1757089
(cherry picked from commit 2a1319ab7a21c2492627c38c5549d20eada899ff)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't set administratively disabled ports as ACTIVE

There was a race condition during port update to disable it.
In case when neutron-server receives port update call to set
admin_state_down on port, it sends PORT_UPDATE notification
to agents.

Then both L2 and DHCP agents start doing their job with port.
L2 agent asks neutron-server about device details and during
processing this call server sets port's status to DOWN if
its admin_state_up = False.
Problem is that sometimes just after that, DHCP agent will send
to neutron server notification that provisioning for this port
is finished.
As there is no any other provisioning block in db (because it
is just port update) neutron-server is setting port's status
to ACTIVE.

This patch fixes this issue by allowing to transition to
ACTIVE only ports which are administratively enabled.

Change-Id: If506e0ff68fc49748f19618470c85901339a419b
Closes-Bug: #1757089
(cherry picked from commit 2a1319ab7a21c2492627c38c5549d20eada899ff)

commit_message:
Make puppet 5.5 unit job voting

If we only run puppet 5 jobs now this should be
voting, puppet 4 unit should still be voting so
that we know if we break puppet 4 support.

Change-Id: I3ed98047e1d62efdbd1c754b70cbd03e757e1051

commit_message:
add neutron/networking projects to blacklist for queens

The introduction of [1] caused complete gate breakage to vmware-nsx
(see logs in [2]) queens jobs and I suspect any project depending on
lbaas. As a result it was suggested we update our queens branch for zuul
v3, done in [3]. However, while [3] appears to get the jobs running the
requirements job is failing because it can't find neutron, and the other
networking project dependencies [4].

This patch adds the neutron/networking dependencies to global
blacklist to address [4].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/576526/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/576822/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/576925/
[4] http://logs.openstack.org/25/576925/2/check/requirements-check/
75bc4c0/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-06-20_19_25_32_069738

Closes-Bug: #1778054

Change-Id: I8a390202e9674e5309540a5c8b70121a9b369b15

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-28 14:06:04.000000000', 'message': 'Move database creation into role (magnum)

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we remove the group_vars which were duplicated from the
role, and remove the DB setup tasks as they are no longer required.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/578812
Change-Id: I0d9ecec55ee15c83159a1ea5715241f53823cd32
'}]
commit_message:
Move database creation into role (magnum)

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we remove the group_vars which were duplicated from the
role, and remove the DB setup tasks as they are no longer required.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/578812
Change-Id: I0d9ecec55ee15c83159a1ea5715241f53823cd32

commit_message:
Add support to select ceph version

We are closing in on adding Ceph Mimic support and
want to ensure we can select either Luminous or Mimic
for running our tests.

For example Ubuntu 18.04 must run Ceph Mimic because
Luminous is not available (yet), Debian doesn't have
Ceph Mimic packages so we must run Luminous there.

Change-Id: If84ecbf86f3ebde8e69a1a26759ad967d061725a

subject: Handle issue caused by pip installed setuptools (Fedora)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-02 13:31:33.000000000', 'message': 'Handle issue caused by pip installed setuptools (Fedora)

setuptools is being installed by pip in the image.
We need it to be used by sealert which looks for
pkg_resources in Python3 pythonpath. setuptools
is being excluded at /etc/dnf/dnf.conf.
This patch removes and reinstall python3-setuptools.

Change-Id: I581c469853ea28e0a75654c5d0f0a5cbdd98d257
'}]
commit_message:
Handle issue caused by pip installed setuptools (Fedora)

setuptools is being installed by pip in the image.
We need it to be used by sealert which looks for
pkg_resources in Python3 pythonpath. setuptools
is being excluded at /etc/dnf/dnf.conf.
This patch removes and reinstall python3-setuptools.

Change-Id: I581c469853ea28e0a75654c5d0f0a5cbdd98d257

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-02 15:16:03.000000000', 'message': "Use tests repo for common role test requirements

Using tox for requirements management requires in-repo
requirements files for all our repositories. Rather than
do that, we make use of the tests repo to capture our
common requirements and use this to install them.

This reduces our review requirement rate and simplifies
maintenance for us for the tox config. It also makes it
usable with 'Depends-On', which is marvellous!

The tox requirements definitions for docs/releasenotes
builds are left in-place as those are standard entries
across the community. If that changes at some point, we
can re-assess those entries too.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579208
Change-Id: I84c8ba7952b15772d9b070dee9ba704cc9de8339
"}]
commit_message:
Use tests repo for common role test requirements

Using tox for requirements management requires in-repo
requirements files for all our repositories. Rather than
do that, we make use of the tests repo to capture our
common requirements and use this to install them.

This reduces our review requirement rate and simplifies
maintenance for us for the tox config. It also makes it
usable with 'Depends-On', which is marvellous!

The tox requirements definitions for docs/releasenotes
builds are left in-place as those are standard entries
across the community. If that changes at some point, we
can re-assess those entries too.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579208
Change-Id: I84c8ba7952b15772d9b070dee9ba704cc9de8339

commit_message:
Use tests repo for common role test requirements

Using tox for requirements management requires in-repo
requirements files for all our repositories. Rather than
do that, we make use of the tests repo to capture our
common requirements and use this to install them.

This reduces our review requirement rate and simplifies
maintenance for us for the tox config. It also makes it
usable with 'Depends-On', which is marvellous!

The tox requirements definitions for docs/releasenotes
builds are left in-place as those are standard entries
across the community. If that changes at some point, we
can re-assess those entries too.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579208
Change-Id: Ic21746968da2f0a091ed2d343561a4e98b8499c0

commit_message:
Use tests repo for common role test requirements

Using tox for requirements management requires in-repo
requirements files for all our repositories. Rather than
do that, we make use of the tests repo to capture our
common requirements and use this to install them.

This reduces our review requirement rate and simplifies
maintenance for us for the tox config. It also makes it
usable with 'Depends-On', which is marvellous!

The tox requirements definitions for docs/releasenotes
builds are left in-place as those are standard entries
across the community. If that changes at some point, we
can re-assess those entries too.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579208
Change-Id: I8df9f72bc23b7552b3097be51bc18cd1ed0e84d4

commit_message:
Add OpenTracing based driver id

Drivers/tracers that follow OpenTracing API are using 64-bit id
instead of 128-bit id like native OSProfiler (uuid4 from uuidutils)

This output is for some tracers like Zipkin, Jaeger.

Depends-On: I8f75af487f50d5e67a1321a4c951d2a0d85733a1
Change-Id: Id4cf07a46e380af9a1aa30352193ca52624fc9eb

after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration

requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Iccee3d8d1807cbbdc3d2d2687cecacc00cd2343d

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/luminous

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Iccee3d8d1807cbbdc3d2d2687cecacc00cd2343d

[{'created': '2018-07-02 07:21:58.000000000', 'message': 'common: fix ansible location

When deploying on arm64, common reports error:
stat /usr/bin/ansible: no such file or directory

The reason is ansible is installed to /usr/local/bin/ansible
rather that /usr/bin/ansible
Fix the issue to call ansible directly, to consider both cases.

Change-Id: Ie90bd9c4d7d3a4b7b0aef884351cb58ed13ebd11
Signed-off-by: Kevin Zhao <kevin.zhao@linaro.org>

'}]
commit_message:
common: fix ansible location

When deploying on arm64, common reports error:
stat /usr/bin/ansible: no such file or directory

The reason is ansible is installed to /usr/local/bin/ansible
rather that /usr/bin/ansible
Fix the issue to call ansible directly, to consider both cases.

Change-Id: Ie90bd9c4d7d3a4b7b0aef884351cb58ed13ebd11
Signed-off-by: Kevin Zhao <kevin.zhao@linaro.org>
Signed-off-by: Zhangfei Gao <zhangfei.gao@linaro.org>
(cherry picked from commit 30f0dc10ce3e41451c6429ee4c79b3ba09a391a1)

'}, {'created': '2018-07-02 17:28:23.000000000', 'message': "Fix requirements and convert to stests

This commit fixes two issues that are currently blocking the gate.

The first is that it bumps the Sphinx requirement to be within
acceptable constraints. The second is that it converts oslo.policy to
use stestr instead of testr. This is all being done in one patch
because proposing them individually causes deadlock (the patch to
bump the sphinx requirement fails because we're still using testr and
the patch to convert to stestr fails the requirements-check job).

The following explains the reasoning behind the stestr change.

With the upgrade to oslotest 3.6.0 [0], testr no longer works [1].
This is because oslotest no longer requires testr and we don't depend
on it directly in oslo.policy.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/requirements/commit/d5a3c58f7195517a6083032e41b702c2a0aca431
[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslotest/commit/897823fbd61ae9ba015af38e9fed5a5728de64c2

Change-Id: I6dac4c8e7b39c9b80cc8f3728763e8d783c9e940

[0] https://github.com/openstack/requirements/commit/d5a3c58f7195517a6083032e41b702c2a0aca431
[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslotest/commit/897823fbd61ae9ba015af38e9fed5a5728de64c2

Change-Id: I6dac4c8e7b39c9b80cc8f3728763e8d783c9e940

commit_message:
Fix requirements and convert to stestr

This commit fixes two issues that are currently blocking the gate.

The first is that it bumps the Sphinx requirement to be within
acceptable constraints. The second is that it converts oslo.policy to
use stestr instead of testr. This is all being done in one patch
because proposing them individually causes deadlock (the patch to
bump the sphinx requirement fails because we're still using testr and
the patch to convert to stestr fails the requirements-check job).

The following explains the reasoning behind the stestr change.

With the upgrade to oslotest 3.6.0 [0], testr no longer works [1].
This is because oslotest no longer requires testr and we don't depend
on it directly in oslo.policy.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/requirements/commit/d5a3c58f7195517a6083032e41b702c2a0aca431
[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslotest/commit/897823fbd61ae9ba015af38e9fed5a5728de64c2

Change-Id: I6dac4c8e7b39c9b80cc8f3728763e8d783c9e940

subject: Move database creation into role
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-06-28 15:36:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-06-28 17:49:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-07-02 09:09:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14805, 'date': '2018-07-02 17:58:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-02 22:37:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:\n\nrecheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-28 15:36:51.000000000', 'message': "Move database creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement a new variable called 'panko_db_setup_host'
which is used in the role to allow delegation of the database setup
task to any host, but defaults to the first member of the galera_all
host group. We also document the variable 'panko_galera_address' which
has been used for a long time, but never documented. A bunch of unused
variables have also been removed.

Change-Id: Ib31b94433183bb12209fe824ea5c8ee67aaa8276
"}, {'created': '2018-06-28 17:49:33.000000000', 'message': "Move database creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement a new variable called 'panko_db_setup_host'
which is used in the role to allow delegation of the database setup
task to any host, but defaults to the first member of the galera_all
host group. We also document the variable 'panko_galera_address' which
has been used for a long time, but never documented. A bunch of unused
variables have also been removed.

Change-Id: Ib31b94433183bb12209fe824ea5c8ee67aaa8276
"}]
commit_message:
Move database creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement a new variable called 'panko_db_setup_host'
which is used in the role to allow delegation of the database setup
task to any host, but defaults to the first member of the galera_all
host group. We also document the variable 'panko_galera_address' which
has been used for a long time, but never documented. A bunch of unused
variables have also been removed.

Change-Id: Ib31b94433183bb12209fe824ea5c8ee67aaa8276

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ia84911ece4666ad69a15b3439e74853aab9ec275

Using tox for requirements management requires in-repo
requirements files for all our repositories. Rather than
do that, we make use of the tests repo to capture our
common requirements and use this to install them.

This reduces our review requirement rate and simplifies
maintenance for us for the tox config. It also makes it
usable with 'Depends-On', which is marvellous!

The tox requirements definitions for docs/releasenotes
builds are left in-place as those are standard entries
across the community. If that changes at some point, we
can re-assess those entries too.

Change-Id: I1c0f315a9260319024dc437654727c6cf646cb2c
"}]
commit_message:
Use tests repo for common role test requirements

Using tox for requirements management requires in-repo
requirements files for all our repositories. Rather than
do that, we make use of the tests repo to capture our
common requirements and use this to install them.

This reduces our review requirement rate and simplifies
maintenance for us for the tox config. It also makes it
usable with 'Depends-On', which is marvellous!

The tox requirements definitions for docs/releasenotes
builds are left in-place as those are standard entries
across the community. If that changes at some point, we
can re-assess those entries too.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579208
Change-Id: I1c0f315a9260319024dc437654727c6cf646cb2c

commit_message:
Use tests repo for common role test requirements

Using tox for requirements management requires in-repo
requirements files for all our repositories. Rather than
do that, we make use of the tests repo to capture our
common requirements and use this to install them.

This reduces our review requirement rate and simplifies
maintenance for us for the tox config. It also makes it
usable with 'Depends-On', which is marvellous!

The tox requirements definitions for docs/releasenotes
builds are left in-place as those are standard entries
across the community. If that changes at some point, we
can re-assess those entries too.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579208
Change-Id: I5a9cac0a65e36bc40300cb67175bd146949ac141

commit_message:
avoid exabgp 4.0.6

ExaBGP has a route parsing bug for VPNv4 default routes.
We need to avoid this version.

A fix has merged in exabgp master, expected to release in
a future 4.0.7.

Change-Id: Id63a6fb6fbb524081ebf46a1ef3492a4eda97868
Closes-Bug: 1779317

commit_message:
Remove token bind capabilities

Token bind operations were deprecated in Pike with UUID tokens and
staged for removal in Rocky.

  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/428388/

This change does keep a configuration option around since it was not
officially deprecated with the rest of the token bind functionality.
The option is being officially deprecated in this commit and
additional context about the change was added to the help text for the
option.

bp removed-as-of-rocky

Change-Id: I7a42408893c782bcc20fb40ebba5f2d8af9da6a5

commit_message:
Test port mac_address update

Adds api admin tests ``test_update_mac`` and ``test_regenerate_mac``.
Also enable the ``port-mac-address-regenerate`` extension in zuul
job.

commit_message:
Added check to avoid keyerror "user['name']"

In get_user_unique_id_and_display_name() of
keystone/auth/plugins/mapped.py, the checking
of user dict's key "name" is not very strict.
So, we need to add more strict validation here.

Change-Id: Ib147e90e4076c1c2ca7a9fd1cf8d17ce3ddc5e34
Closes-Bug: #1711883

commit_message:
Remove tox_install.sh

Fully removing tox_install.sh as it is no longer needed with zuulv3.

The change in requirements.txt carried by the patch being cherry-picked
had to be dropped as 'neutron' is not in openstack/requirements
for stable/queens.

Change-Id: I72745f088a92010e43d7c078f8de05d529d20930
(cherry picked from commit 3c1e4ba2e38f21c4686abe2e078301855e1d4216)

commit_message:
Add constraints for the neutron-lbaas

Installing unpinned version of the neutron-lbaas depend on the
neutron version which is not compatible with pinned neutron-lib so
we need to pin it to the latest Quuens version 12.0.0.

Closes-Bug: #1777655
Change-Id: I49727fb75d9d8c8f411a6c9ca2ef3a3d2836d41b
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>

subject: Use tests repo for common role test requirements
messages: [{'account_id': 28521, 'date': '2018-07-02 17:00:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-02 17:02:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-07-02 23:17:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-02 17:00:53.000000000', 'message': "Use tests repo for common role test requirements

Using tox for requirements management requires in-repo
requirements files for all our repositories. Rather than
do that, we make use of the tests repo to capture our
common requirements and use this to install them.

This reduces our review requirement rate and simplifies
maintenance for us for the tox config. It also makes it
usable with 'Depends-On', which is marvellous!

The tox requirements definitions for docs/releasenotes
builds are left in-place as those are standard entries
across the community. If that changes at some point, we
can re-assess those entries too.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579208
Change-Id: Ia3b65cfc2362bbc09f7dc3fff3d767a649fea9f8
"}]
commit_message:
Use tests repo for common role test requirements

Using tox for requirements management requires in-repo
requirements files for all our repositories. Rather than
do that, we make use of the tests repo to capture our
common requirements and use this to install them.

This reduces our review requirement rate and simplifies
maintenance for us for the tox config. It also makes it
usable with 'Depends-On', which is marvellous!

The tox requirements definitions for docs/releasenotes
builds are left in-place as those are standard entries
across the community. If that changes at some point, we
can re-assess those entries too.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579208
Change-Id: Ia3b65cfc2362bbc09f7dc3fff3d767a649fea9f8

commit_message:
Cleanup directory creation tasks

Using the realpath filter, we can idempotently create/modify
the log directory whether it is a symlink or not. This allows
us to consolidate two tasks into the common directory creation
task.

The extra task to create the images directory can be consolidated
into the same common directory creation task.

We also convert the items list to yaml dictionary format to
match the desired style according to the style guide.

Change-Id: I46e8b7c3be005681efc8a520318e7945c9c9a259

commit_message:
Remove mox in unit/network/test_neutronv2.py (1)

Replace mox with mock
in nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py.

This patch moves the following methods in the TestNeutronv2 class
to the TestNeutronv2WithMock class.

* test_get_instance_nw_info_1
* test_get_instance_nw_info_2

This patch adds the _TestNeutronv2Common class
for test classes that uses mock instead of mox.
The original TestNeutronv2Base class will be removed and
the _TestNeutronv2Common class will be renamed to 'TestNeutronv2Base'
when replacing mox is completed in the file.

Subsequent patches will replace mox in other test cases.

Change-Id: I691d00127e96bb99b088cf19dc8466807af92051
Implements: blueprint mox-removal

commit_message:
py3: port proxy/controllers/info.py

Yes, this means you can now start a proxy-server process on py3! And it
will give you something useful on /info!

Apparently you can even get auth tokens from tempauth, although the
tempauth unit tests don't pass yet.

Change-Id: I86ead2989b5934a7584cdd75719ce239826e01ec

commit_message:
Avoid using deprecated opt in Web-UI

Use new opt instead of deprecated opt to avoid KeyError.

Change-Id: I9bff33eac9c756afb571f81824a8a3242477f321
Closes-Bug: #1777705

commit_message:
Move database creation into role (barbican)

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we remove the group_vars which were duplicated from the
role, and remove the DB setup tasks as they are no longer required.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/574847
Change-Id: Ie58d61938753a9a1626f721909546682f75ecf87

commit_message:
Drop SELinux support from os_swift

The rules are not currently maintained, nor do we have the resources
to maintain them.  In addition, they most likely don't work in our
integrated repos.

For future, it would be best to depend on upstream packages for
SELinux support such as `openstack-selinux`.

Change-Id: I6203b98a96a341ce52930ceeed609d9c118ae8b8
